In this world, the concept of cannibalism is not only accepted, but it's also deeply ingrained in our culture and daily life. We've transcended the primitive, savage connotations associated with cannibalism and have elevated it to an art form, a celebration of life, and a symbol of community bonding.

At the core of our society lies the "Circle of Life" philosophy, which emphasizes the interconnectedness of all living beings. We believe that every individual has a role to play in the grand symphony of existence, and that death is not an end, but a transformation. When a person passes on, their body is not wasted, but rather, it's honored and utilized to nourish others. This mindset has fostered a profound sense of respect, empathy, and unity among our people.
